Description: Limestone sculpture fragment of naked bearded man wearing a cap or helmet, face turning to right and smiling. Figure is sitting with crossed legs (broken and missing) with erect phalus (broken and missing). Arms are both broken and missing, but appear to have been up in the air. Nose and lips broken. Covered in red paint, with details around eyes in black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Face is remeniscent of Assyrian style horsemen figures of the Late Period found at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CE.189) (Phase 3)
